pros: Prior to UPMC taking over the system,  Altoona Regional Health System was an excellent place to work.
cons: Some employees took advantage of the company regarding benefits such as abuse of sick time.

pros: I am currently in the Medical Laboratory Science school and I love it. There are 5 students in the class and we get hands on lab experience with real time patients and learn to operate all the instruments.
cons: I don't have any cons for this program.

review_title: A secure company that treats its employees decently.
pros: Long term employer in a difficult economy. Good benefits and decent saleries. Multiple shifts that work with your family life.
cons: Being a good worker doesn't lead to better salaries or better jobs. Being a union facility, there are employees that need to be reprimanded or dismissed but are protected by the unions.

pros: Good health benefits, PTO. Co workers are very helpful however, it depends on which unit you are in. Salary raise every year.
cons: Poor staffing. No consideration with patient's equity. I work in a Palliative/Medical Oncology Unit with no CNA or just 1. No help given. Management turns a blind eye to existing issues. Employees are just numbers, replaceable.

pros:
Pay is fair for the area 
Co-Workers are fantastic on some floors
cons:
Management on some floors can act as bullies
Little recognition for hard work
Frequent nit-picking
VERY poor, frequently unsafe staffing
Low patient satisfaction rates due to poor staffing

cons: Cliques, salary, management, narrow minded, unrealistic expectations
